image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Chris Bowen sit behind a table, as Albanese holds up a document. Four people stand behind them.

props.synopsis: Australia's next major climate commitment will be above the ambitions of New Zealand and Canada, but below the United Kingdom, as the government strikes a middle path in pursuit of both an "ambitious" but "achievable" 2035 target.

title.children: Australia's 2035 climate target will strike a middle path. Will it be enough?

image.altText: A yellow sun rises into a red sky over the ocean

props.synopsis: Locals in small northern WA communities say the potential dangers identified by the Climate Risk Assessment are already starting to appear.

title.children: Remote communities adapting to extreme climate impacts warn 'lives at stake'

image.altText: grey smoke rises over gaza after an explosion in the area

props.synopsis: The European Union's executive arm has made a series of proposals aimed at forcing an end to the Israel–Hamas conflict.

title.children: European Commission proposes new sanctions on Israel over war in Gaza

image.altText: vogel gfx

props.synopsis: The chair of the Northern Territory's Environment Protection Authority has become a "strategic adviser" to a miner but denies he has a conflict of interest.

title.children: NT environment regulator takes side job with miner amid calls to quit over gas leak 'scandal'

image.altText: A man dressed in a grey suit speaking on a stage.

props.synopsis: Prominent left-wing commentator Hasan Piker opens up to 7.30 on Donald Trump's left-wing crackdown, the Charlie Kirk he knew and attempts to have him deplatformed.

title.children: Political opponent speaks out against 'dishonest' Charlie Kirk rhetoric

image.altText: Princess Catherine speaks happily a man at a dinner while Donald Trump sits on her other side

props.synopsis: The US president has received a royal welcome to mark the start of his second official state visit, but not everyone is happy.

title.children: Pomp, ceremony and protests greet Donald Trump in UK

image.altText: Aung San Suu Ky looks intensely into the camera at a conference.

props.synopsis: One of the world's most recognised pro-democracy activists needs urgent medical care as she serves a 27-year sentence in a "hellhole" prison, her son has claimed.

title.children: Former human rights leader now stuck in a prison 'hellhole', son claims

image.altText: A man with grey hair and beard, wearing glasses, poses with a tub of ice-cream

props.synopsis: Ben & Jerry's co-founder, Jerry Greenfield, has resigned after a feud with parent company Unilever over Gaza conflict.

title.children: Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits over Gaza dispute with parent company Unilever

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and James Marape at a press conference in front of their respective flags.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese was meant to emerge from his recent flurry of Pacific diplomacy holding no fewer than two major agreements — instead he's returning home conspicuously empty-handed.

title.children: Why the PM went zero-for-two on his Pacific diplomatic tour

image.altText: A man in grey suit

props.synopsis: Christian Brueckner is released from a German prison where he has been serving a seven-year sentence for an unrelated sex crime.

title.children: Main suspect in Madeleine McCann case freed from prison

image.altText: Gout Gout puffs out his cheeks

props.synopsis: Gout Gout has powered home to claim third place in his heat and secure a spot in the 200m semifinals at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, after Torrie Lewis ran a PB to reach the semifinals. Follow live.

title.children: Gout Gout, Torrie Lewis qualify for 200m semifinals

image.altText: A young caucasian man wearing a green shirt smiles

props.synopsis: Key moments that led to the identification and arrest of the man accused of murdering Charlie Kirk have been laid out in fresh court documents released by US authorities.

title.children: Alleged Charlie Kirk killer's confession to lover revealed in text messages

image.altText: A white tent with "American Comeback Tour" written on it is seen behind police tape and a uniformed officer.

props.synopsis: US police have charged a 71-year-old man they say has admitted to yelling out that he shot conservative activist Charlie Kirk in order to "allow the actual suspect to flee".

title.children: Man admits he claimed to be Charlie Kirk gunman so real suspect could flee

image.altText: Sport underway inside proposed stadium.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Planning Commission described the Hobart stadium as a "singular, large, bulky monolith" with "optimism bias" in the government's cost-benefit figures. What does this mean for the stadium?

title.children: Is Hobart's proposed AFL stadium now dead?

image.altText: A minesite.

props.synopsis: Mining giant Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane and the Bowen Basin in the wake of BHP Mitsubishi Alliance axing 750 workers.

title.children: Second Qld coal miner cuts jobs as royalties spark concerns

image.altText: A close up of a woman's torso where there is a scar and the Olympic rings tattooed on top of it.

props.synopsis: Making it to the Paris 2024 Olympics was a career highlight for Jean Mitchell — and the brain cancer survivor marked the achievement in a special way.

title.children: Why this rower got an Olympic rings tattoo over her chemo scar

image.altText: People walk on the footpath under the UTS building.

props.synopsis: The University of Technology Sydney will close its schools of education and public health under a multi-million-dollar restructure.

title.children: UTS cuts more than 1,100 subjects and 134 full-time jobs in restructure

image.altText: A close up of a statue of the Lady of Justice with dark clouds in the background.

props.synopsis: Once the new legislation takes effect in November, the use of good character references will be limited when determining penalties for sex offenders.

title.children: Queensland restricts use of good character references in sentencing sex offenders

image.altText: A tractor and trucks piled high with belongings on a dirt road with blue sky

props.synopsis: Israeli troops encircle Gaza City as the UN chief slams the offensive as "systematic destruction", with thousands of Palestinians unable or unwilling to flee.

title.children: Israel 'burning' Gaza, defence chief says, as army deepens ground assault

image.altText: A woman standing with arms on a fence.

props.synopsis: Farmers in southern New South Wales are protecting parts of their land in perpetuity, fencing off tens of hectares for conservation.

title.children: Farmers paid to fence off land forever for conservation

image.altText: Rooster

props.synopsis: A South Australian council has taken a disability pensioner to court to remove his allegedly noisy roosters, but he has argued the council's application should not proceed because it is discriminatory and the birds are his "therapeutic" animals.

title.children: Man tries to stop council application to remove 'therapy' roosters

image.altText: People standing around a hole next to an excavator on a residential property.

props.synopsis: Bones have been found at a Port Lincoln property in the search for the remains of Susan Goodwin, who went missing in Port Lincoln decades ago.

title.children: Man charged with murder after cold case breakthrough

image.altText: Alexei Navalny, a young man in a dark sports jacket, speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Yulia Navalnaya says that laboratory analysis of smuggled biological samples had found he was killed by poisoning while incarcerated in prison in February 2024.

title.children: Alexei Navalny's wife says Russian opposition leader was killed by poisoning

image.altText: A video of Trump and Epstein is projected onto a stone castle's side.

props.synopsis: The shots included Donald Trump's mugshot, portraits of Epstein, newspaper headlines, and footage of the two men dancing together.

title.children: UK protesters arrested after beaming Epstein video ahead of Trump visit

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and James Marape

props.synopsis: A major defence treaty between Australia and Papua New Guinea has failed to get over the line today, with the countries resorting to signing a communique in lieu of the actual document.

title.children: Australia and PNG fail to clinch defence agreement

image.altText: Graphic of child looking at a screen with the logos of all social media companies with squiggles in the background.

props.synopsis: The social media saga has produced its fair share of intrigue. But the latest big reveal on how the ban will work has left us with just another cliffhanger.

title.children: There's a chance you won't even notice the teen social media ban. Here's why

image.altText: A light brown beetle and smaller brown larvae pictured in a microscopic picture with grains of rice in background.

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating how khapra beetle, the number-one-priority pest for the grains industry, entered Australia.

title.children: Major threat to Australian grains industry found in imported nappy pants

image.altText: A black background with GIM in white and an orange symbol.

props.synopsis: After the ABC revealed GIM Trading had raised millions from customers who later suspected fraudulent activity, a judge has prohibited the current director from leaving the country.

title.children: ASIC secures court order to stop GIM Trading director from leaving country

image.altText: A close up of Sussan Ley.

props.synopsis: In her first major economic speech, the opposition leader hits out at universal subsidies and says "dependency" has affected Australia's "national character".

title.children: Australians too dependent on government, says Sussan Ley

image.altText: A young girl dressed in pink lays on the ground as her father draws around her with chalk.

props.synopsis: A state government body sat on a report into lead dust that was "poisoning" children for nearly four years and tried to keep its release quiet.

title.children: Australian children 'living in poison' with lead in bloodstream at high levels

image.altText: A man sits in an office with a pen in his mouth.

props.synopsis: The Hollywood icon leaves a legacy of classic films with a career that stretched over decades.

title.children: Looking back at some of Robert Redford's most notable movies from the 1960s to the late 2010s

image.altText: A mine and train.

props.synopsis: One of Queensland's biggest coal miners says it does not want to see jobs lost but blamed "the Queensland government's unsustainable coal royalties and market conditions".

title.children: BHP alliance to sack 750 workers blaming Qld mining royalties

image.altText: The words "FEDERAL RESERVE" engraved on a stone building.

props.synopsis: The world's largest central bank is less than 24 hours from announcing one of the most anticipated interest rate decisions of the year.

title.children: Federal Reserve stares down worst-case scenario: US economy in stagflation

image.altText: A blooming canola crop spells out the words "will you marry me", as seen from above.

props.synopsis: NSW farmer Will Henderson had no choice but to bide his time to pop the question. In the end his efforts were rewarded.

title.children: Farmer goes above and beyond for sky-high wedding proposal
